vectorData.altText: of the lung, adjacent to the diaphragm. Because the lungs are pyramidal in shape, they are described as having a base and
IDENTIFY the costal surface of the lung,
its extensive curved surface, adjacent to the ribs. Identify the mediastinal surface of the lung, adjacent to the mediastinum.

In the mediastinal surface, identify the hilum of the lung, the region where the airways, nerves, blood vessels and lymphatics that service the lung enter or leave the organ. These structures themselves, bound together by connective tissue, are the root of the lung.

an apex     . The diaphragmatic surface of the lung is also known as the base of the lung.  Identify the apex of the lung, opposite its base. The apex of the lung extends above the clavicle into the thoracic inlet. 
Now that you have examined the lungs, set them out of the way for the time being, perhaps at the foot of the table, wrapped in a damp cloth to keep them from drying out.
